identificationModule.briefTitle: Ischemic Stroke in Chinese Young Adults
identificationModule.officialTitle: Some Biomarkers Underlying in Ischemic Stroke in Chinese Young Adults: a Protocol for a Case-control Clinical Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Director, Head of Endocrinology, Principal Investigator

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Stroke is the fifth leading cause of death in the United States and the leading cause of disability. However, in China, stroke is one of the most frequent causes of death and chronic disability. Ischemic strokes in adults younger than 45 years of age were regarded as a relatively uncommon event in the proportion of \<5% of all ischemic strokes.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Currently, stroke is the fifth leading cause of death in the United States and the leading cause of disability. However, in China, stroke is one of the most frequent causes of death and chronic disability. Ischemic strokes in adults younger than 45 years of age were regarded as a relatively uncommon event in the proportion of \<5% of all ischemic strokes. Our study aimed to evaluate some Biomarkers Underlying in Ischemic Stroke in Chinese Young Adults.

armGroups.label: Ischemic Stroke in Young Adults
armGroups.description: Patients between 18 and 45 years of age with a first ever ischaemic stroke are eligible for this study from the Department of Beijing Chaoyang Hospital between January 1, 2016 and December 31, 2016. All patients were defined as a sudden loss of global or focal cerebral function that persisted with a probable vascular cause for 24h and confirmed by brain CT or MRI.

armGroups.label: matched control subjects
armGroups.description: The age-, sex-, and time of enrollment-matched control cohort was randomly identified after eliminating the study subjects and those who had been given a diagnosis of any stroke at any time.

interventions.name: Ischemic Stroke
interventions.description: Ischemic Stroke in Chinese Young Adults

primaryOutcomes.measure: the incidence of Ischemic Stroke in Chinese Young Adults
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: every two months, up to 24 months

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients between 18 and 45 years of age with a first ever ischaemic stroke are eligible for this study from the Department of Beijing Chaoyang Hospital between January 1, 2016 and December 31, 2016.
* All patients were defined as a sudden loss of global or focal cerebral function that persisted with a probable vascular cause for 24h and confirmed by brain CT or MRI.

Exclusion Criteria:

* The exclusion criteria will include patients with intracranial lesions or cerebrovascular disease (including cerebral venous sinus thrombosis)
* History that have caused sequelae, such as movement disorders, mood disorders, cognitive dysfunction or speech problems; or individuals who are pregnant or breast feeding.
* Patients with serious diseases that are related to the heart, liver, kidney or haematopoietic system will not be allowed to participate.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients between 18 and 45 years of age with a first ever ischaemic stroke are eligible for this study from the Department of Beijing Chaoyang Hospital between January 1, 2016 and December 31, 2016. All patients were defined as a sudden loss of global or focal cerebral function that persisted with a probable vascular cause for 24h and confirmed by brain CT or MRI.
